phones.name: iPhone 7
phones.description: Apple iPhone 7 smartphone was launched in September 2016. The phone comes with a 4.70-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 750 pixels by 1334 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch. Apple iPhone 7 price in India starts from Rs. 38,990.

phones.name: iPhone 8
phones.description: Apple iPhone 8 smartphone was launched in September 2017. The phone comes with a 4.70-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 750 pixels by 1334 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch. Apple iPhone 8 price in India starts from Rs. 57,999.

phones.name: iPhone XR
phones.description: Apple iPhone XR smartphone was launched in September 2018. The phone comes with a 6.10-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 828 pixels by 1792 pixels at a PPI of 326 pixels per inch. Apple iPhone XR price in India starts from Rs. 69,999.

phones.name: iPhone XS
phones.description: Apple iPhone XS smartphone was launched in September 2018. The phone comes with a 5.80-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 1125 pixels by 2436 pixels at a PPI of 458 pixels per inch. Apple iPhone XS price in India starts from Rs. 96,801.

phones.name: Galaxy A7
phones.description: The Samsung Galaxy A7 (2017) is built using aluminium and glass which makes it feel very premium. However, given its 5.7-inch display size, the phone feels bulky and heavy. It doesn’t have the best ergonomics either. The Super Amoled display produces good colours and brightness although we weren’t to pleased with the tone of the whites.

phones.name: Galaxy J6+
phones.description: Samsung Galaxy J6+ smartphone was launched in September 2018. The phone comes with a 6.00-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 720 pixels by 1480 pixels. Samsung Galaxy J6+ price in India starts from Rs. 12,990.

phones.name: Galaxy Note9
phones.description: The new Galaxy Note 9 has much the same hardware and cameras as the Galaxy S9 Plus. The main thing that sets the Galaxy Note 9 apart is its S Pen, which now has added Bluetooth connectivity and can be used as a single-button Bluetooth remote control.

phones.name: Galaxy S9
phones.description: The Samsung Galaxy S9 features a metal and glass design, with tapering edges on both sides. It has a 5.8-inch Quad HD+ Super AMOLED display with an 18.5:9 aspect ratio. Touch response and colours are superb and it also supports HDR. In India, the phone uses an Exynos 9810 octa-core SoC and comes with 4GB of RAM a choice of 64GB or 256GB internal storage, which is expandable.

phones.name: Mi 8
phones.description: Mi 8 smartphone was launched in May 2018. The phone comes with a 6.21-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 1080 pixels by 2248 pixels at a PPI of 402 pixels per inch. Mi 8 price in India starts from Rs. 24,500.

phones.name: Mi A2
phones.description: The Mi A2 from Xiaomi is a part of Google's Android One Program. It sports a 5.99-inch display with fullHD+ resolution and Corning Gorilla Glass 5 for protection. It is powered by a Snapdragon 660 processor, has 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage.

phones.name: Mi MIX 3
phones.description: The Mi Mix 3 is powered by octa-core processor and it comes with 6GB of RAM. The phone packs 128GB of internal storage that cannot be expanded. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Mi Mix 3 packs a 12-megapixel (f/1.8, 1.4-micron) primary camera and a 12-megapixel (f/2.4, 1-micron) secondary camera on the rear.

phones.name: Redmi Note 6 Pro
phones.description: The Redmi Note 6 Pro is the successor of the Redmi Note 5 Pro. It has a notched display that measures 6.26 inches and has Corning Gorilla Glass for protection. Powering the Redmi Note 6 Pro is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 636 processor which is an octa-core processor clocked at 1.8GHz. There is 6GB of RAM and 64GB of storage. It has a hybrid dual-SIM slot which you can use to expand storage.
